```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(aesummaries)
library(magrittr)
library(kableExtra)
library(dplyr)
```

## Forest Plot

This is an example forest plot output given the built in `testdata`

```{r, echo=FALSE}
head(testdata) %>%
  select(-X) %>%
  kable()
```

The `forestplot` function has many parameters we need to specify:

1) `data` the dataset to make the forestplot with
2) `high_level_col` this column...
3) `low_level_col` this column...
4) `group1_col`
5) `group2_col`
6) `numerator1_col`
7) `numerator2_col`
8) `denominator1_col`
9) `denominator2_col`
10)  `test_col`
11)  `result_col`
12)  `result_upper_col`
13)  `result_lower_col`
14)  `p_col`
15)  `width`
16)  `height`
17)  `elementId`

```{r}
forestplot(testdata)
```
